element.name: Slí Slán Eile by orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (2/2.5)

long-description.center: This is the second of three multicache based around the Slí na Sláinte routes in Swords. This one follows the Highfield Slí. The walks are circular routes to be walked in either direction from any starting point.

Similarly, this cache can be started from any waypoint in any order. Find the required information at each waypoint, work out the final coordinates and find the cache. In the spirit of the Slí doing it on foot will do your heart a world of good. This Slí is about 4k long. Finding the cache may be a bit more depending on your starting point.

A handy pdf map of walks can be downloaded
here.

At the above coordinates:
How many pillars guard the entrance? A
View Stage: N 53° 27.239 W 006° 14.390
How many Slí na Sláinte signs are visible at this point? B

Park Stage: N 53° 27.195 W 006° 14.502
How many lamp posts illuminate this area? C
Forest Stage: N 53° 26.988 W 006° 14.509
Count the number of letters on the signs? D
Boru Stage: N 53° 26.844 W 006° 14.251
How many speed bumps are there between this junction and the

marked starting point at N 53° 27.268 W 006° 13.532? E
The Cache

element.additional-waypoints:
BS21AAB - Boru Stage
N 53° 26.844 W 006° 14.251
FS21AAB - Forest Stage
N 53° 26.988 W 006° 14.509
PS21AAB - Park Stage
N 53° 27.195 W 006° 14.502
VS21AAB - View Stage
N 53° 27.239 W 006° 14.390

ul.li:
2010-04-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Fjon
Found this one ok after a drive and walk through Swords' housing estates. The park was lovely this morning, the days are starting to get warmer and plenty of people were out walking dogs and jogging.

2009-12-28T20:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Nice little multi...found ok after a bit of maths...TFTC..

2009-12-07T20:00:00Z : Found it by toczygroszek
Decided go for 3 "Slí Slán" caches today, but found only this one. Good bit of walk, and nice area. TFTC

2009-12-07T20:00:00Z : Found it by Hezekiah
Found easily - great day for a walkabout! TFTC!

2009-11-24T20:00:00Z : Found it by Windsockers
This was an old stomping ground for me years ago never really noticed how large the area is till today.
At one point I had to do a uturn thanks to todays picketlines :-)
Found the cache with spot on coords.
TnLnSl
Thanks for the ramble.

wpt.name: GC21AAB
wpt.desc: Slí Slán Eile by orangetigerprawn, Multi-cache (2/2.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Slí Slán Eile
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This is the second of three multicache based around the Slí na Sláinte routes in Swords. This one follows the Highfield Slí. The walks are circular routes to be walked in either direction from any starting point.




Similarly, this cache can be started from any waypoint in any order. Find the required information at each waypoint, work out the final coordinates and find the cache. In the spirit of the Slí doing it on foot will do your heart a world of good. This Slí is about 4k long. Finding the cache may be a bit more depending on your starting point.


A handy pdf map of walks can be downloaded here.


At the above coordinates:
How many pillars guard the entrance? A

View Stage: N 53° 27.239 W 006° 14.390
How many Slí na Sláinte signs are visible at this point? B

Park Stage: N 53° 27.195 W 006° 14.502
How many lamp posts illuminate this area? C

Forest Stage: N 53° 26.988 W 006° 14.509
Count the number of letters on the signs? D

Boru Stage: N 53° 26.844 W 006° 14.251
How many speed bumps are there between this junction and the
marked starting point at N 53° 27.268 W 006° 13.532? E

The Cache

Final Location: N 53° 27.(B*D*E)-(D-A*B)
W 006° 1C.0(D*B+A+E)


 


Additional Waypoints

BS21AAB - Boru Stage
N 53° 26.844 W 006° 14.251

FS21AAB - Forest Stage
N 53° 26.988 W 006° 14.509

PS21AAB - Park Stage
N 53° 27.195 W 006° 14.502

VS21AAB - View Stage
N 53° 27.239 W 006° 14.390

Nice little multi...found ok after a bit of maths...TFTC..
Decided go for 3 "Slí Slán" caches today, but found only this one. Good bit of walk, and nice area. TFTC
Found easily - great day for a walkabout! TFTC!

This was an old stomping ground for me years ago never really noticed how large the area is till today.
At one point I had to do a uturn thanks to todays picketlines :-)
Found the cache with spot on coords.
